snippet: Culture is a census obstacle: Many Afghans lack surnames, most do not know their birthday and women will not speak if their husbands are out.
abstract: Kabul Journal; census workers in Afghanistan are having a difficult time conducting survey because many Afghans lack surnames, most do not know their birthday and women will not speak without their husbands present; number of people living in Afghanistan is unknown; last census, conducted in 1979, found some 14.6 million people, but some estimate that current census will register more than double that number.
lead_paragraph: Culture is a census obstacle: Many Afghans lack surnames, most do not know their birthday and women will not speak if their husbands are out.

headline.main: For Afghans, Name and Birthdate Census Questions Are Not So Simple
headline.print_headline: Obstacles Beyond Number for the Afghan Census
